articles.content:
British Organizations Express Solidarity with S. Korean People's�@Struggle 
    Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- The British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and Works of Comrade Kim Jong Il, the British Association for the Study of the Songun Politics and the British Society for Friendship with Korea sent a letter of solidarity to the Central Committee of the National Democratic Front of South Korea on June 13.
 Two years have passed since two school-girls were killed in cold blood by GIs in south Korea, the letter said, extending solidarity to the righteous struggle of the south Korean people not to allow their death to be in vain.    
 The letter strongly demanded the immediate and unconditional withdrawal of the U.S. imperialist aggression troops from south Korea. It hoped that Korea would be reunified at an early date and all the Korean people would be made to live in a peaceful land without interference of the U.S. imperialists.

Preparations for Construction of Glass Factory 
    Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- Preparations for a ground-breaking ceremony of a glass factory provided gratis by the Chinese government to the DPRK are being pushed ahead.
 There was a blasting for blowing 400,000 cubic meters of earth to rezone the building plot on Friday.    
 With the successful blasting the preparations for the ground-breaking ceremony have come near completion.

articles.content:
Greetings to Madagascan President
    Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to Madagascan President Marc Ravalomanana on June 23 on the occasion of the national day..
 Expressing the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would further strengthen and develop, the message sincerely wished him and the Madagascan people great successes in the work for national unity and development of the country.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Djibouti
articles.content:
Greetings to Mozambican President
    Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to Mozambican President Joaquim Alberto Chissano on June 23 on the occasion of the 29th anniversary of its independence.
 Expressing the belief that the good relations of friendship between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms, the message sincerely wished the President and the Mozambican people great successes in the work for the progress and prosperity of the country.

Greetings to President of Djibouti
    Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to President of Djibouti Ismail Omar Guelleh today on the occasion of the 27th anniversary of its independence.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would continue to strengthen and develop, the message sincerely wished him greater success in his work for the stability and development of the country.

Greetings to Slovenian President
    Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People' Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to Slovenian President Janez Drnovsek on June 25 on the occasion of its independence.
 Expressing the belief that the relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms, the message sincerely wished the friendly Slovenian people prosperity and wellbeing.

articles.title: Chinese Military Delegation Here
articles.content:
Message of Solidarity to President of Democratic Congo
    Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on June 23  sent a message of solidarity to Maj.GeneralJoseph Kabila, president of Democratic Congo, on hearing the news that the government and people of Democratic Congo brought under control in time the situations that threatened the peace process in the country.
 It is well known to the Korean people that the government and people of the country under your correct leadership have made efforts to defend peace and stability in the country and successfully implement the tasks in the period of transition even under the complicated situation, the message said.    
 Extending full support and solidarity to the president and his people in the just struggle, the message expressed expectation and belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would as ever steadily grow stronger.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation Returns
articles.content:
Chinese Military Delegation Here
    Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the border guards of the Chinese People's Liberation Army led by Lieut. General Li Yu, assistant to the chief of the General Staff of the army, arrived here Saturday.
 It was greeted at the airport by Maj. General Han Tong Su and officers of the Korean People's Army, Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Wu Donghe and Military Attache Yang Xilian of the embassy.    
 The General Staff of the KPA arranged a reception in honor of the delegation in the evening.
